meaningMnemonic: You know that お願い means "a request," and 事 can mean "thing." Well, a request for some specific thing can also be called <vocabulary>one's wish</vocabulary> or a <vocabulary>prayer</vocabulary>. Do you have any 願い事 in your heart right now? Of course you do! Don't worry, you can tell me.
readingMnemonic: The readings come from the words お願い and 事. If you know how to read those you should be able to read this word too. Just remember that 事 is rendaku'd, so it's read as ごと.
